jence.jni

Class J4210U.ReaderInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • jence.jni.J4210U.ReaderInfo
  • Enclosing class:
    J4210U

    public static class J4210U.ReaderInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses the reader information data from the device driver and assigns them to the public variables. After these variables are reassigned with new valuees, the class has toByteArray() method to return the byte array that is needed to be passed to the driver for saving the settings.
    Author:
    Ejaz Jamil

    • Field Detail

      • Serial

        public int Serial
        The devices read only serial number. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • VersionInfo

        public byte[] VersionInfo
        The device firmware read only version number String. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • Antenna

        public byte Antenna
        Number of antenna (read only) this device support. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • ComAdr

        public byte ComAdr
        Read only com address of the device. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • ReaderType

        public byte ReaderType
        Read only reader type. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • Protocol

        public byte Protocol
        Read only protocol number. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • Band

        public byte Band
        Frequency band to be used during scanning. This variable can be assigned 'U' (USA), 'K' (Korea), 'C' (China) and 'E' (EU).

      • Power

        public byte Power
        Power to be used during scanning. This variable is in the range 0 - 26.

      • ScanTime

        public int ScanTime
        Scan time in 100 ms unit for scanning. The value can be 1-255 representing 100 ms - 25.5 s. A value of 10 means 1s (10 * 100 = 1000 ms)

      • BeepOn

        public byte BeepOn
        Turn on/off beep. 0 = Off, 1 = On.

      • Reserved1

        public byte Reserved1
        Unused.

      • Reserved2

        public byte Reserved2
        Unused.

      • MaxFreq

        public int MaxFreq
        Read only maximum frequency for the band. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • MinFreq

        public int MinFreq
        Read only minimum frequency for the band. Assigning this variable does not have any effect.

      • BaudRate

        public int BaudRate
        Baud rate to be used for next use. The allowed values are 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600 and 115200. Any other values will be rejected. After saving the setting, the effect is immediate. That means, the device is to be reconnected using the new baud rate.
